summary: This is a Department of Justice press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors between 1994 and 1997, and for perjury in 2016 depositions. It details her alleged role in grooming and facilitating abuse and announces her arrest in New Hampshire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting them, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's co-conspirator with a preference for young girls. The alleged abuse scheme was centered around him.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged role in the abuse scheme.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director in Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Announced the charges and made a statement praising the victims for their bravery.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Announced the charges and commended investigators for their work.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge assigned to Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Jim Margolin
persons.context: Listed as the press contact for the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell facilitating, grooming, and participating in the abuse.
Alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor victims to Epstein for sexual abuse, and to have participated in abuse herself.
Alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with acts including sexualized massages and direct sexual contact.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, grooming and abusing victims as young as 14.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during a civil deposition.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrest and Indictment
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and an indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

locations: New Hampshire (location of federal court for initial presentation)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors from at least 1994 to 1997.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in grooming victims as young as 14 by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual behavior with Epstein.
Maxwell is also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in a 2016 civil deposition.
The alleged abuse occurred at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's London residence.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and perseverance.
